snippet: The first lady told a group of high school students and parents on Wednesday not to let financial concerns stand in the way of a college education.
abstract: Michelle Obama tells a group of high school students and parents not to let financial concerns stand in the way of a college education as she urges them to apply for federal student aid; speaks at event that is part of an effort by Get Schooled, nonprofit group that works in partnership with Viacom and uses television, social media and celebrities to encourage students to graduate from high school and go to college.
lead_paragraph: The first lady told a group of high school students and parents on Wednesday not to let financial concerns stand in the way of a college education.

headline.main: Michelle Obama Urges Students to Apply for College Aid
headline.print_headline: First Lady Urges Students to Apply for College Aid
